dialog: I was only 12 years old, naive and somewhat trusting.
But all that was about to change.
Some babysitters take you to the movies, or rollerblading in the park.
Mine brought me on a date with a serial killer.
Not my idea of a romantic evening.
All drugged up and tied to a chair.
I knew we should have gone to the movies.
I wanted to get out of there as fast as I could.
As soon as I was free, I got really pissed.
He was about to make a real mess of my babysitter.
So, I did what many of you would have done, I took matters into my own hands.
And it changed my life forever.
Is everything all right in there?
I thought I heard a crash.
They found Bateman and his final victim a few days later.
The FBI quickly uncovered a psychopath, and a few extra unsolved murders, and he became an instant celebrity, an overnight sensation.
They even wrote a book about him.
Only in America. As for me?
I was never tied to the scene.
And rather than selfdestruct, or spend the rest of my life on some shrink's couch, I told no one of what had happened.
I silently vowed to devote my life to stopping other psycho killers.
I couldn't wait to grow up.
The next six years of my life were a blur.
My parents wrote me off emotionally.
My mom became a raging alcoholic, and my dad was busy fucking the secretary.
So, here I am today, attending the most renowned behavioral studies program in the nation.
Here they focus on profiling, the art, craft and science of tracking serial killers.
The subject matter itself attracts some weirdos.
But then again, maybe it's just me...
The problem is, I don't have time for games.
I have got to focus on my work.
You can do better than that.
Studying murder often brings out the best in people.
Getting into West Washington wasn't easy.
I busted my ass in high school and maintained a perfect All this, so I could study with the best mind in the field, Professor Robert Starkman.
Possibly the most revered hunter of serial killers the FBI ever produced.
After solving every high profile crime ever thrown at him, he suddenly made a startling life change and became a teacher.
Some say it was his last case, the mysterious death of serial killer Patrick Bateman.
Funny how life works, isn't it?
Starkman never discusses the Bateman case...
Congratulations on getting through the first half of the semester...
the official application form for the teacher's assistant position for next year.
This is my golden ticket to Quantico, the FBI's elite training program.
Unfortunately, everyone else is here for the same reason.
They know that nine out of Starkman's last 10 assistants, were accepted into the FBI.
...Announcing my new assistant by the end of the week, just before we head off for Spring Break.
And, talking about Spring Break, don't forget the party at the Dean's mansion.
We will have the opportunity to say goodbye to Miss McGuire who's leaving us for bigger and better things.
Well, after weeks of grueling, if not gruesome work, let's have some fun, shall we?
Today we will be looking at the unique aliases the FBI, the press and the general public have nicknamed serial killers, and why.
His present TA is Elizabeth McGuire.
She's already been accepted to Quantico...
I am the front runner to replace her.
Nobody comes close to my rock solid GPA.
Dr. H.H. Holmes was once vilified, in a biography, as the "Arch Fiend." I'd like to say none of them have a chance, but grades aren't everything.
And I do have some competition.
A GPA as low as his wouldn't normally pose a threat.
But his family's fortune, easily numbering in hundreds of millions, can open a lot of doors.
How do you think he got into the school?
AKA "The Werewolf of Wisteria." Contender two: Cassandra Blaire.
They say she and Starkman have been going at it since the beginning of the semester.
He's old enough to be her grandfather.
"The Black Widow" who murdered four of her husbands.
He poses the biggest threat of the three.
He and I have been sparring all year in this class.
But, I have yet to lose a single round.
The fact is, none of them have a chance.

Red lips, red leaves fall on my knees like autumn I miss cigarettes every single day of my life When you make love to me I close my eyes and pray you say goodbye Damn She's dawning on me She's beautiful And I bet you don't know what love means It's just that you do not love me.
The application is a mere formality.
Come Friday, I will be Starkman's new teaching assistant.
I deserve it and I am going to get it.
Yes, there may be a few more hoops I have to jump through, but I can handle them.
Besides, failure is not an option.
Why don't we just start over here, because I suggest you reconsider your position on this.
Your GPA is simply not high enough.
Are you saying no to me?
Do you know who my father is?
I am well aware of your family's legacy.
Heed my advice. A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
I have some advice for you.
Get ready to take a long vacation.
Go with God, dear heart. Next!
Wait till she sees my GPA after my cousin hacks into their mainframe.
Do they give these things up for bitch of the month?
That hag could be the reigning champion.
She's lucky I don't bash her brains in.
I was told to drop off my application here.
Looks like everything's in order here.
It says here that you're a freshman.
We don't usually allow freshmen or sophomores to become TAs.
You have to be a junior or above.
Professor Starkman told me I could apply.
Shouldn't this decision be left up to the professor?
I will run this up the flagpole and see who salutes.
I will have to speak with your teacher.
I have a schedule to keep.
We do this for your own good.
Freshmen can be extremely overwhelmed, being at college, and away from home for the first time in their lives.
"Beat common freshmen fears in 10 easy steps." So many new experiences.
Look, the only experience I want is to be Professor Starkman's TA next semester.
Afraid not! It just wouldn't be right.
I am sure he will put in a good word for you, but I don't see how I can make any exceptions at this point without setting a dangerous precedent in school policy.
I will be informing the Dean of the situation.
You will just have to wait.
Ricky, you got some explaining to do.
Bad things Dead things Sad things have to happen Bad things Dead things Sad things have to happen.
No, Rachael. If I was stalking you, you'd know it.
I thought we should get together and...
discuss the state of the union and life in general.
My inside source says he has narrowed it down.
Guess who's still in the running?
Unless you can raise your GPA.
Do you want to catch a bite to eat tomorrow night, maybe some dinner and discuss it?
What's to discuss? It's no big news.
We were always the front runners.
We could get together and form an alliance, eliminate our competition.
I have a paper to write.
We should get to know each other better.
Is it just me or is there unspoken sexual tension between us?
We should bring it to the surface and stop lying to each other.
I don't know. It was white, it was in a pipe So, what do you say?
I have a paper to write.
I won't take no for an answer twice in one day.
You have to eat, right? I have to eat.
I was just fucking around with this sexual tension stuff.
I just throw stuff out there.
I am crazy, I am like a volcano, just waiting to erupt Okay!
Okay, fine. Pick me up at 8:00.
Because it's great for me I will see you at 8:00.
Maybe I will be there five minutes later.
So...what are you doing for Spring Break?
I am just going to hang around and get some work done.
Because I have work to do.
My family's coming for my mom's birthday to see how the other half lives.
Bobby's taking me up to his cabin in the Northern Cascade Cassandra, don't call him Bobby in front of me.
Professor Starkman is taking me up to his cabin.
He's got to go upstate first, to meet Diane and Louisa.
You mean, his wife and his daughter?
He's meeting them at his inlaws.
I can't stand how much of his time they take up.
I am late for a study session.
I can't believe you're actually going out with Brian.
the other day, our eyes met across a crowded room, and there was thisthis spark, the sign I have been waiting for my whole life.
It was then that I knew that Brian was my soul mate.
It's great to be with you tonight.
Hi. Can I get you something to drink?
Yes. I will have a Kettle One martini, straight up, very dry. Very, very dry.
I will have a glass of house red.
Good. I will be right back.
It's great that we finally have some "us" time.
Yeah. Listen, Rach, before we embark on our evening, I have a confession to make.
Can you wait until we get our drinks before you start making your confessions?
Can you just give us a minute here?
Okay. What would you like to confess?
This is difficult for me, because I really want us to remain friends after regardless of who Starkman picks for the TA position.
You should know I am determined to get the position.
Over the last few months, I have been doing a little research on Cassandra Blair.
Let's just say that if she gets the position, the Dean's office is going to receive an anonymous letter regarding her and Starkman's relationship, accompanied by some very revealing photographs.
I guess that narrows it down to three.
You know who my father is, right?
Yes, we're all in awe of your family's money.
You know, you and Keith are very smart.
So I have had to go to great lengths to ensure that my bright future in the FBI goes without a hitch.
That is the press release for the new CarsonLeads Behavioral Sciences Building.
It's just one of my dad's new pet projects.
I have an offer you can't refuse.
Drop out of the race for the TA position, and I will ensure you have seven digits of my family's gratitude.
Just think of it as a business opportunity.
Trust me, the alternative wouldn't be too pleasant.
"I will let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours." What?
Bob Dylan, maybe you have heard of him?
You know, Brian, you should get out more.
Do you want to be my girl?
Do you want to be my friend?
Do you want to start it all?
We can stop if you want.
No, no...I just don't What, you don't have any?
Don't worry, I will take care of everything when the time comes.
Oh, the old "pull out and pray" trick.
The convenience store, down the street I will just go down there, it's right around the corner.
It's really convenient and I will get some, I will get tons.
Wait a minute, what am I saying?
My roommate's got tons of them, drawers full of them.
I will walk down the hall, and get some from a friend.
But you have got to look at the positive side...
I am killing for a better tomorrow.
Once I get into the FBI, I will be able to stop dozens, maybe even hundreds of serial killers every year.
I am killing the few to save the many.
Sort of like Robin Hood, you know?
God, I think I need some professional help.
Rachael, have you ever been to a psychiatrist before?
You want answers, so we get together weekly, and we ask the questions that will lead you to your answers.
I could tell you anything, and you'd still never know me.
You could, and that's your choice.
But why would you lie to me?
Because I don't expose my Achilles' heel to anyone.
I just need to be on watch.
If I am not looking out for number one, then who is?
It's a dogeatdogworld out there, and my future depends on not getting eaten by the other dogs.
I have schedules, appointments and dreams that only I can fulfill.
No one is going to do that for me.
Who do you think is keeping you from achieving these goals?
Anyone who gets in my way.
If you could be anyone in the world, except yourself, who would that be?
And the next in line to go to Quantico.
Have you ever wanted something so bad that you'd do anything to get it?
And that's why I went to West Washington.
I have always known that, really, there were only three other people who could steal the TA position away from me.
What happens if you don't get the position?
How can you be so sure?
My secretary will get your billing info.
I just had a first time session with one of your students.
Aren't we violating some sort of privacy code here?
Yes and no. I will tell you what...
I won't tell you the name, if you promise not to say it once you have figured it out.
I think I have identified this person as a textbook sociopath.
It's a prerequisite for getting into college in the first place.
Tell me about it. Still, this girl has no concept of reality or the difference between right or wrong.
She's obsessed with becoming your assistant next semester.
If that's her obsession, it's no big deal.
These kids think I am their ticket to the FBI.
Jesus, if she's that dangerous, tell me her name before she turns up in class with an AK47.
I can't do that. I have already broken the law by placing this call.
Just be aware this student's in your class.
What exactly do you mean, "be aware"?
Just make sure she doesn't get out of hand.
She's identified three of her peers Dr. Daniels?
I have got to go, I have got an appointment.
Okay, I will see you this weekend. Bye.
I am so sorry to disturb you.
I didn't realize you were on the phone and your secretary wasn't there.
I just left my keys here.
I am such a textbook nut case sometimes.
I'd probably lose my head if it wasn't screwed on.
It's so nice that you stay in touch with your mom.
So many new and exciting things, the golden years.
No. I am My wife and I never had children.
I have another patient coming in soon.
I have to prepare for him.
So I will have to ask you to leave.
An appointment downtown or a patient in your office?
It's not nice to lie to your dear old mom.
After my session with Eric, I really needed some therapy.
That guy just about drove me nuts.

So, I went back to something my dad always said, "nothing like a change of scenery to clear your head, to ease the burden of a busy schedule." Besides, tonight's the Behavioral Sciences party at the Dean's.
I want to be dressed to kill.

Sometimes she feels so sad And other times feels twice as bad When the tears are in her eyes She never cries Ordinary girl I know We're different But I am stranger in the world Ordinary girl Ordinary.
The Anthony Perkins character in Psycho was modeled on Ed Gein.
My heart rate nearly triples when I get there and see the vultures have descended upon Starkman.
He broke the mold because he only killed two people in his entire career.
I must have lost track of time running on.
I had planned to get here early to get as much time with Starkman as possible.
And now I am late. This is a disaster.
...for Leatherface in The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Hello, Miss Brown.
How was your date with Brian?
I mean, "it." We didn't get that far.
What do you mean? Why did you come to borrow a rubber, if he went home after dinner?
What's up with the third degree?
I am just confused. Did you guys get it on or not?
It's like you're not even here.
What did you do last night?
I am sorry. Professor Starkman came over for a study session.
And let me assure you, it was definitely not short.
What are you smiling at, freak?
BobI mean the professor, said I am a shooin for the TA position.
I wasn't supposed to tell anyone, but since we are so close...
Now I get to spend all this time with my sweetie.
And his wife will think we're working.
Wait, maybe I will go to Quantico.
Let's blow it off and you give me the details.
Perfect. Let me talk to Starkman, and we will go to Jittery Joe's for coffee.
You don't want anyone to know about you and Bobby.
Let's grab some wine and go to your room.
Just make sure you don't tell anyone, okay?
Don't worry, I would never let you down.
Like I said, Cassie, studentteacher relationships just never work out.
It's Cassandra, I can't get to the phone, so leave a quickie and I will get back to you.
Listen, it's 11:25 and you missed your study session.
I am sorry to drop in without an appointment, but there is something on my mind.
Any word on that TA job yet?
He won't announce it until before Spring Break.
When does that start for you guys?
And how do you feel about that?
You think you will get the job?
Worst case scenario: you don't get the job. What then?
What are you talking about, Dr. Daniels?
You want me to come up with some idea of what's wrong with me, but I will be honest. I came here to tell you I am not coming back next week.
Don't worry, I have every intention to pay for your time.
However, I feel the problem we have connecting lies mostly with you.
Look, this is a small town.
My guess is you know almost everyone here.

It must be so disappointing to see all these college kids come in and out of your town every year, moving on to bigger and better opportunities, while you stay here, year after year, getting older and older.
And all while taking care of your dear old mom.
And on top of this, you're divorced?
God! The female population in this town, aside from the sexy little college girls running around, must be pretty weak.
This alone would cripple any man.
Your level of frustration must be through the roof.
A deadend job with no love life, all while taking care of your sick mom.
Just the other day, I noticed you were judging me.
Is that fair? I mean really, is that?
Your life is very similar to Ed Gein's.
Yes, Ed Gein. Very famous serial killer.
A bachelor, raised by his domineering mother, until she died when he was roughly your age.
God, he went nuts! He couldn't handle the loss.
What would you do without your mother?
You don't know me, and I don't know you.
We were getting to know each other.
So don't go jumping to conclusions.
No. I am not jumping to any conclusions here.
If you just open up your eyes, you'd see I am already there.
Let's talk about Ted Bundy for a minute, shall we?
What kind of a killer was he?
He was perceived as a very organized killer.
Come on, this guy planned each and every detail in advance.
He chose his victims with extreme accuracy, stalked them meticulously, and waited for the precise moment to attack.
All while maintaining an air of patience not even the FBI's greatest could penetrate.
And he picked all his dumping sites with the outmost caution.
He was unquestionably an organized killer.
It's a letter in the alphabet.
Between "O" and "Q." You have something to say, Miss Newman?
He started out organized, but spiraled down late in his socalled career.
He began to keep bodies for days, washing their hair and even applying makeup before disposing of them.
And he littered the dumping sites with evidence, using the outmost caution.
However, his last victim, and his youngest girl ever, fell out of his typical victim selection.
She was chosen out of sheer availability.
He was both, an organized killer and offthecharts lunatic.
With a capital "L." You're right. He was both.
Now, Professor Starkman, how would you classify a killer whose downward spiral was actually calculated into their grand scheme?
That's a very interesting hypothesis, Miss Newman.
Unfortunately, in this class, we stick to the facts.
And there's no known casestudy of that nature.
Keith's little display of brainpower was totally unacceptable.
It's a day before Starkman announces his new TA.
I wasn't about to watch years of hard work go down the drain.
It was time to pick Keith's brain.
You know that feeling you get when you realize that there are people out there just like you?
It almost makes you feel normal.
All this time, I thought he was taking notes.
But no. Look at his work, his sketches.
This may be a waste of a rare mind.
But, a girl's got to do what a girl's got to do.
So, the big day's tomorrow, right?
My chances are much better this year than they were last.
I would think so. It's a very tight race this year.
She probably left for Spring Break.
Well, actually, the It's Cassandra, isn't it?
Good for her, but I can't say I am not disappointed, but "what doesn't kill you makes you stronger." I will see you.
I can't get to the phone, so leave a quickie and I will get back to you.
The "she" whose name we agreed not to say aloud.
You didn't say she was suicidal.
She had suicidal tendencies, but I was more concerned for the sociopathic and homicidal patterns that were emerging.
she may have been a little forward, but she wasn't crazy!
I am sorry, but you didn't see what I saw.
She was not a pretty picture.
Listen, Eric, I spent a lot of time with her, and I have to say I don't agree on this one.
There are tons of kids in your classes.
How could you know her as well as you think you did?
We're bound by the guidelines of doctorpatient privilege, right?
No wonder she was obsessing over you.
How could you do this to Diane?
Fine. Why did you call me, then?
I just needed someone to talk to.
Can you get me some Valium?
Yeah. I will call it in to the pharmacy.
Can I give you some advice?
So, here we are. The big day.
In moments, I will be crowned Starkman's new TA, and be one step closer to the FBI.
Too bad Brian, Cassie and Keith couldn't be here to watch me.
But wherever they are, I am sure they will realize they didn't give up their lives in vain.
Guys, can I have your attention, please?
Professor Starkman told me to tell you that unfortunately he's decided that his sabbatical, which was scheduled for next year, is now effective immediately.
In other words, there will be no TA position for next semester.

This is an obsession A kind of aggression with himself It's the way he will always be He loves to rebel To go against his Ten Commandments For him That's just being free And over there Stands my angry angel And he's shaking his head In disgrace with me Over there Stands my angry angel And he's frowning like hell But I am not feeling guilty.
Why why haven't you gone home?
I will just hang around here during the break.
Don't you have family waiting at home for you?
Actually, they will come visit me here.
I heard about the change in plans.
Is that all you people ever think about?
I have a schedule, a plan, a dream. I need it!
What makes you think you will get it?
I believe I am the most qualified for this position.
Name someone who's more dedicated or intelligent, that's had more experience than me.
You don't know what you're talking about.
I have a confession to make.
I have had feelings for you for a long time, longer than you can imagine.
I have always wanted something to happen between us.
Okay. I am a little confused.
You are? How do you think I feel?
But it was okay for you and Cassandra?
How did I don't know what you're talking about. Leave.
Ever since I first saw you.
Before Clara even ever loved you.
How did you know about Clara?
Clara was babysitting me that night.
Clara used to babysit me all the time.
She'd tell me about your relationship with her.
She'd show me pictures of you.
You were in Patrick Bateman's apartment...
I know you quit the FBI because of what happened.
I think you blame yourself for her death.
She was the one who looked through your stuff and found Bateman's file.
And she went to his apartment that night and dragged me along.
She went over there to cheat on you.
And so did Cassandra. She thought you didn't love her enough.
I won't let anyone stop me, not even Diane and your baby.
So now you care about your family?
You just can't hold a relationship together.
But you're just the opportunity of a lifetime.
After you can't break any more hearts, you will still break one more...your baby daughter's.
The sun is shining We should be making haste I hope you had a safe trip.
We are sleeping on our feet We stole the songs from birds in trees But it's time on easy street Now it's past, and it's not me.
Yeah, that's it. Bring it back.
Back it up. That's it. You got it.
Bring it in here. Thank you very much.
I sure do hope you have got Holy shit.
You have reached Professor Starkman, in the Behavioral Sciences Department.
I felt bad about the other day.
I wanted to say I am sorry.
I hope you got that prescription filled okay.
Call me if you need anything. Bye.
Mary, if that's Bobby Starkman, I will take it.
He will take you at 3:00. All right.
It was for an appointment, not the professor.
I put her in at 3:00, Rachael Newman.
She wanted to come in today.
I can reschedule if you want.
I am no, I amI am fine.
It's justit's been a long day.
Let me know if you need anything.
You have reached Professor Starkman in the Behavioral Sciences Department.
Call me when you get this.
I am really confused about something.
If you don't reach me by 3:00, I will drop by your office between 4:00 and 4:30.
Jeez, I am sorry. Please, come in.
We have been planning this for months.
Sweet Jesus! It smells like somebody died in here.
The toilet's clogged up and maintenance isn't up and running, so there's nothing I can do.
Sweetheart, you are such a clotheshorse.
What will I do with you?
Look at me, always spoiling the surprise.
What will we eat? I am hungry.
I am going out of town later tonight.
Is there an early bird special?
Is that Italian? Your father cannot digest Italian food.
I have got to finish packing and finish writing some papers.
So why don't you go back to the motel and we will meet at the restaurant at 5:30?
I have got to use the head.
How will we ever find this place?
We will be back at 5:15 to pick you up.
You have reached Professor Starkman in the Behavioral Sciences Department.
I know you're going through tough times, but shethe she who hung herself she made an appointment to see me.
I don't know if it's a joke, but something's off.
Roses are red, violets are blue, the Daniels will soon be calling back you.
Mom, you have got to change that message.
I will come by around 5:30 to pick you up for your big date.
And I will get you back in time for Murder She Wrote. Bye.
This is the most beautiful thing I have ever received in my life.
Anyway, as I was saying before, I said to Leora she ought to have it looked at immediately.
And when she sees the doctor, he orders a biopsy and it comes back positive.
If she had taken my advice, she could have avoided this mess!
I know we will eat dinner at some point.
I will go use the restroom.
Don't forget to wash your hands.
Now, where is my steak knife?
That sounds clichÃ©, but how many people envision carving into their mother's neck and yanking out her vocal cords?
Or ripping her tongue out and serving it to her as an earlybird special?
I have got a table right here for you.
Why don't you sit on the other side?
Get a view of the whole thing.
Could I have un autre, uh...
How about a table closer to the window?
I was wondering if we could get a table closer to the window.
That section is closed for Spring Break.
Can I get you something to drink?
I will have a whiskey sour. Mom?
I will need some water to take my pills.
As I stare at myself in the mirror, I realize I can't let my mother get the best of me.
I am Robert Starkman's next TA.
And that's where I will focus my energies.
I should set up a meeting with Bobby when I get back.
Maybe we can brainstorm at his cabin tonight.
I will make him my special eggs.
Maybe you'd give us some more time?
I will be just over there.
And this must be your mother.
I'd kill for a hat like that.
I have to be getting back to my table.
It was nice meeting you too.
I am a friend of your daughter's. Ms. Newman, could I have a word with you for a moment?
Mom, Dad, I will be just a minute.
Didn't he call her a different name?
You have some explaining to do.
First of all, you insult me.
Then I hear you have hung yourself.
And you act like nothing happened.
Eric, why would you say that?
Let's say a mutual friend told me he found you.
Is this some sort of sick joke?
He never found me. He found her.
What's important is my mom's birthday, and she's here.
I will catch up with you later.
Honey, why did he call you Ms. Newman?
I don't know. Could we just eat?
I have to go home and pack.
We never get a chance to see you.
I wish I could, but I can't.
Thank. We might have a bit of trouble.
If it's not Sigmund Freud himself!
I want to file a missing person's report on Robert Starkman.
His wife called 20 minutes ago to do the same thing.
He didn't show up at his inlaws upstate like he was supposed to.
It's the third MPR we have filed this year. Right, Jimmy?
I have got a brand new one here.
A woman, Gerty Fleck, from Student Services.
And of course, that Newman girl.
Newman, yeah, that was seven months ago......
The first day of the semester.
Jimmy and I toddled up on campus to check it out.
I am Sheriff Winslow, and this is Deputy Duncan.
Just looking for a Are you Rachael Newman?
We're checking on a MPR on yourself.
Are you sure I can't offer you some tea?
I actually know this Rachael Newman girl.
To be honest, I don't trust her.
Are you telling me the parents just dropped the report?
I never said nothing about parents.
The Newman girl, she was an orphan.
The report was filed by some student friends of hers.
But it was a false alarm.
How do you know it was her?
There's only one Rachael Newman registered at school.
Can I convince you guys to come to the campus with me to make sure everything's okay?
You're reached Professor Starkman in the Behavioral Sciences Department.
I hope you're as excited as I am.
If you need me to go to the store, I will be here another five minutes.
Now, how did you get open?
Trying to sneak out on me?
I just brought you up and you're already causing problems.
Don't fall apart on me now, Rach.
Actually, I like your name too.
You don't mind if I borrow it?
Well, this is a wildgoose chase, I guess.
Hey, Mom, I know I have been out of touch, but I got accepted to West Washington.
I know. Can you believe it?
